maml:description.maml:para: Installs a printer driver on the specified computer.
The Add-PrinterDriver cmdlet installs a printer driver on the specified computer.
You cannot use wildcard characters with Add-PrinterDriver . You can use Add-PrinterDriver in a Windows PowerShell remoting session.
You need administrator credentials to run Add-PrinterDriver .
Specifies the name of the printer driver.
Specifies the path of the printer driver INF file in the driver store. INF files contain information about the printer and the printer driver.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the computer on which to install the printer driver.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the printer driver environment.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the computer on which to install the printer driver.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the path of the printer driver INF file in the driver store. INF files contain information about the printer and the printer driver.
Specifies the name of the printer driver.
Specifies the printer driver environment.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command installs the printer driver specified by the Name parameter on the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 2: Add a printer driver on remote computer ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command installs the printer driver specified by Name on the remote computer specified by the ComputerName parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the list of printer drivers installed on the specified computer.

The Get-PrinterDriver cmdlet retrieves the list of printer drivers installed on the specified computer. The Get-PrinterDriver cmdlet returns a printer driver object that you can store in a variable to use with other cmdlets. You can specify the ComputerName parameter to list the printer drivers installed on another computer.
You can use wildcard characters with Get-PrinterDriver . You can use Get-PrinterDriver in a Windows PowerShell remoting session.
You do not need administrator credentials to run Get-PrinterDriver .
Specifies the name of the printer driver to retrieve.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the computer from which to retrieve the printer drivers.
Specifies the printer driver environment.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the computer from which to retrieve the printer drivers.
Specifies the name of the printer driver to retrieve.
Specifies the printer driver environment.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
This cmdlet returns one or more printer driver objects.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a list of printer drivers using wildcard characters

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns a list of printer drivers installed on the local computer by using wildcard characters.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a list of printer drivers on a remote computer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a list of printer drivers from the computer named PrintServer.

command:example.maml:title: ---- Example 3: Get detailed information about each driver ----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays the detailed information for each printer driver. Get-PrinterDriver displays a summarized view of each printer driver queried.

command:example.maml:title: ------------ Example 4: Get a printer driver object ------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves a printer driver object that you can use with other cmdlets. The printer driver object is stored in the $PrinterDriver variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes printer driver from the specified computer.

The Remove-PrinterDriver cmdlet deletes a printer driver from the specified computer. You can specify the printer driver to remove by using either a printer object retrieved by Get-Printer, or by specifying a printer name.
You can use wildcard characters with Remove-PrinterDriver . You can use Remove-PrinterDriver in a Windows PowerShell remoting session.
You need administrator credentials to run Remove-PrinterDriver .
Specifies the name of the printer driver to remove.
Specifies the printer driver environment.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the computer name from which to remove the printer driver.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies whether to remove the printer driver from the driver store.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.

Specifies the computer name from which to remove the printer driver.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the Microsoft XPS Document Writer v4 driver.
